D:/GDA/gda-trunk/users/scripts/Introduction_to_GDA_objects.py

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 # When the GDA is started, all the devices are accessible in the Jython interpreter
00002 
00003 # Jython objects have been created which represent the devices
00004 
00005 # Optical Elements (OEs) are groups of motors belonging to a particular part of the beamline
00006 # to list them:
00007 
00008 list OE
00009 
00010 # And to see all detectors:
00011 
00012 list Detector
00013 
00014 # and to see all countertimers (which are a sub-type of detectors):
00015 
00016 list CounterTimer
00017 
00018 # All OEs have various degrees of freedom (DOFs) associated with them.
00019 # To list all the DOFs for an object:
00020 
00021 dofs Mi_JackingTable
00022 
00023 # array(['RearLeftJack', 'FrontJack', 'RearRightJack'], java.lang.String)
00024 
00025 # To access one of these DOFs, a variable has automatically been created which has 
00026 # the same name, but in lowercase!!
00027 
00028 print frontjack
00029 
00030 # this is to make typing faster and easier.  This means that all DOFs on a beamline
00031 # must have a unique name.
00032 
00033 # Objects which represent DOFs and devices in the Jython environments are known
00034 # as "scannables" (er, because they can participate in scans)
00035 
00036 # all scannables have a common set of methods which you can call:
00037 
00038 print frontjack.getPosition()
00039 frontjack.moveTo(10)
00040 print frontjack.getPosition()
00041 frontjack.moveBy(5)
00042 print frontjack.getPosition()
00043 
00044 # to make typing faster for these most common commands, the GDA has a special
00045 # extended syntax for Jython.
00046 
00047 # so the above commands would be:
00048 print frontjack
00049 pos frontjack 10
00050 inc frontjack 5
00051 
00052 # these commands are not 'real' Jython, but they can be used in the GDA environment
00053 # if required,  beamline-specific commands can be created  for frequent repeated commands
00054 
00055 # to find the full list of extended syntax commands, type:
00056 
00057 help
